summary: The energy demands of bitcoin mining have sparked controversy in a state that once welcomed those companies with open arms.
title: For Bitcoin Mines in Texas, the Honeymoon Is Over
detailed_content: Three years ago, bitcoin miners flocked to the state of Texas. The Lone Star State offered cheap power, plentiful supplies of renewable energy, and an accommodating regulatory climate. Some mining companies already operated there, but when China banned crypto mining in May 2021, a mass migration began. Texas was fast becoming “a Mecca for bitcoin miners,” said Greg Abbott, the state governor. But lately, the mood has shifted.
author: BY JOEL KHALILI
